title: betaSandwich: Robust Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
text: Generates robust confidence intervals standardized regression coefficients using heteroskedasticity-consistent standard errors models fitted lm() described Dudgeon (2017: http://doi.org/10.1007/s11336-017-9563-z). description package code examples presented Pesigan, Sun, Cheung (2023: https://doi.org/10.1080/00273171.2023.2201277).

title: betaSandwich: Robust Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
text: can install CRAN release betaSandwich : can install development version betaSandwich GitHub :
code: install.packages("betaSandwich") if (!require("remotes")) install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("jeksterslab/betaSandwich")

title: betaSandwich: Robust Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
text: example, multiple regression model fitted using program quality ratings (QUALITY) regressand/outcome variable number published articles attributed program faculty members (NARTIC), percent faculty members holding research grants (PCTGRT), percentage program graduates received support (PCTSUPP) regressor/predictor variables using data set 1982 ratings 46 doctoral programs psychology USA (National Research Council, 1982). Robust confidence intervals standardized regression coefficients generated using BetaHC() function betaSandwich package following Dudgeon (2017).
code: library(betaSandwich) df <- betaSandwich::nas1982

what: Fit the regression model using the lm() function.
title: betaSandwich: Robust Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
code: object <- lm(QUALITY ~ NARTIC + PCTGRT + PCTSUPP, data = df)

what: Estimate the standardized regression slopes and the corresponding robust sampling covariance matrix.
title: betaSandwich: Robust Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
code: BetaHC(object, type = "hc3", alpha = 0.05) ## Call: ## BetaHC(object = object, type = "hc3", alpha = 0.05) ##  ## Standardized regression slopes with HC3 standard errors: ##            est     se      t df      p   2.5%  97.5% ## NARTIC  0.4951 0.0786 6.3025 42 0.0000 0.3366 0.6537 ## PCTGRT  0.3915 0.0818 4.7831 42 0.0000 0.2263 0.5567 ## PCTSUPP 0.2632 0.0855 3.0786 42 0.0037 0.0907 0.4358

title: betaSandwich: Robust Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
text: package can also used generate confidence intervals R-squared, adjusted R-squared, differences standardized regression coefficients.

title: betaSandwich: Robust Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients

what: Fit the regression model using the lm() function.
title: betaSandwich: Example Using the BetaHC Function
code: object <- lm(QUALITY ~ NARTIC + PCTGRT + PCTSUPP, data = df)

what: Estimate the standardized regression slopes and the corresponding robust sampling covariance matrix.
title: betaSandwich: Example Using the BetaHC Function
code: BetaHC(object, type = "hc3", alpha = 0.05) #> Call: #> BetaHC(object = object, type = "hc3", alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Standardized regression slopes with HC3 standard errors: #>            est     se      t df      p   2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC  0.4951 0.0786 6.3025 42 0.0000 0.3366 0.6537 #> PCTGRT  0.3915 0.0818 4.7831 42 0.0000 0.2263 0.5567 #> PCTSUPP 0.2632 0.0855 3.0786 42 0.0037 0.0907 0.4358

title: betaSandwich: Example Using the BetaHC Function
code: out <- BetaHC(object, type = "hc3", alpha = 0.05)

title: betaSandwich: Example Using the BetaHC Function
text: Summary results BetaHC().
code: summary(out) #> Call: #> BetaHC(object = object, type = "hc3", alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Standardized regression slopes with HC3 standard errors: #>            est     se      t df      p   2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC  0.4951 0.0786 6.3025 42 0.0000 0.3366 0.6537 #> PCTGRT  0.3915 0.0818 4.7831 42 0.0000 0.2263 0.5567 #> PCTSUPP 0.2632 0.0855 3.0786 42 0.0037 0.0907 0.4358

title: betaSandwich: Example Using the BetaHC Function
text: Calculate standardized regression slopes.
code: coef(out) #>    NARTIC    PCTGRT   PCTSUPP  #> 0.4951451 0.3914887 0.2632477

what: Fit the regression model using the lm() function.
title: betaSandwich: Example Using the DiffBetaSandwich Function
code: object <- lm(QUALITY ~ NARTIC + PCTGRT + PCTSUPP, data = df)

previous_headings: Estimate the standardized regression slopes and the corresponding sampling covariance matrix.
title: betaSandwich: Example Using the DiffBetaSandwich Function
code: std_mvn <- BetaN(object)

previous_headings: Estimate the standardized regression slopes and the corresponding sampling covariance matrix.
title: betaSandwich: Example Using the DiffBetaSandwich Function
code: std_adf <- BetaADF(object)

previous_headings: Estimate the standardized regression slopes and the corresponding sampling covariance matrix.
title: betaSandwich: Example Using the DiffBetaSandwich Function
code: std_hc3 <- BetaHC(object, type = "hc3")

what: Estimate differences of standardized regression slopes and the corresponding sampling covariance matrix.
title: betaSandwich: Example Using the DiffBetaSandwich Function
code: mvn <- DiffBetaSandwich(std_mvn, alpha = 0.05) adf <- DiffBetaSandwich(std_adf, alpha = 0.05) hc3 <- DiffBetaSandwich(std_hc3, alpha = 0.05)

title: betaSandwich: Example Using the DiffBetaSandwich Function
text: Summary results DiffBetaSandwich().
code: summary(mvn) #> Call: #> DiffBetaSandwich(object = std_mvn, alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Difference between standardized regression coefficients with MVN standard errors: #>                   est     se      z      p    2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.1037 0.1357 0.7640 0.4449 -0.1623 0.3696 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.2319 0.1252 1.8524 0.0640 -0.0135 0.4773 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.1282 0.1227 1.0451 0.2960 -0.1123 0.3688 summary(adf) #> Call: #> DiffBetaSandwich(object = std_adf, alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Difference between standardized regression coefficients with MVN standard errors: #>                   est     se      z      p    2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.1037 0.1212 0.8555 0.3923 -0.1338 0.3411 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.2319 0.1181 1.9642 0.0495  0.0005 0.4633 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.1282 0.1215 1.0555 0.2912 -0.1099 0.3664 summary(hc3) #> Call: #> DiffBetaSandwich(object = std_hc3, alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Difference between standardized regression coefficients with HC3 standard errors: #>                   est     se      z      p    2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.1037 0.1417 0.7316 0.4644 -0.1741 0.3814 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.2319 0.1318 1.7595 0.0785 -0.0264 0.4902 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.1282 0.1375 0.9329 0.3509 -0.1412 0.3977

title: betaSandwich: Example Using the DiffBetaSandwich Function
text: Calculate differences standardized regression slopes.
code: coef(mvn) #>  NARTIC-PCTGRT NARTIC-PCTSUPP PCTGRT-PCTSUPP  #>      0.1036564      0.2318974      0.1282410 coef(adf) #>  NARTIC-PCTGRT NARTIC-PCTSUPP PCTGRT-PCTSUPP  #>      0.1036564      0.2318974      0.1282410 coef(hc3) #>  NARTIC-PCTGRT NARTIC-PCTSUPP PCTGRT-PCTSUPP  #>      0.1036564      0.2318974      0.1282410

title: betaSandwich: Example Using the DiffBetaSandwich Function
text: Calculate sampling covariance matrix differences standardized regression slopes.
code: vcov(mvn) #>                NARTIC-PCTGRT NARTIC-PCTSUPP PCTGRT-PCTSUPP #> NARTIC-PCTGRT    0.018408653    0.009511262   -0.008897391 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP   0.009511262    0.015672035    0.006160773 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP  -0.008897391    0.006160773    0.015058164 vcov(adf) #>                NARTIC-PCTGRT NARTIC-PCTSUPP PCTGRT-PCTSUPP #> NARTIC-PCTGRT    0.014681407    0.006928651   -0.007752755 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP   0.006928651    0.013938955    0.007010303 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP  -0.007752755    0.007010303    0.014763058 vcov(hc3) #>                NARTIC-PCTGRT NARTIC-PCTSUPP PCTGRT-PCTSUPP #> NARTIC-PCTGRT    0.020076382    0.009274583   -0.010801799 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP   0.009274583    0.017370731    0.008096148 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP  -0.010801799    0.008096148    0.018897947

title: betaSandwich: Example Using the RSqBetaSandwich Function
code: object <- lm(QUALITY ~ NARTIC + PCTGRT + PCTSUPP, data = df)

previous_headings: Estimate the standardized regression slopes and the corresponding sampling covariance matrix.
title: betaSandwich: Example Using the RSqBetaSandwich Function
code: std_mvn <- BetaN(object)

previous_headings: Estimate the standardized regression slopes and the corresponding sampling covariance matrix.
title: betaSandwich: Example Using the RSqBetaSandwich Function
code: std_adf <- BetaADF(object)

previous_headings: Estimate the standardized regression slopes and the corresponding sampling covariance matrix.
title: betaSandwich: Example Using the RSqBetaSandwich Function
code: std_hc3 <- BetaHC(object, type = "hc3")

what: Estimate the multiple correlation coefficients (R-squared and adjusted R-squared) and the corresponding sampling covariance matrix.
title: betaSandwich: Example Using the RSqBetaSandwich Function
code: mvn <- RSqBetaSandwich(std_mvn, alpha = 0.05) adf <- RSqBetaSandwich(std_adf, alpha = 0.05) hc3 <- RSqBetaSandwich(std_hc3, alpha = 0.05)

title: betaSandwich: Example Using the RSqBetaSandwich Function
text: Summary results RSqBetaSandwich().
code: summary(mvn) #> Call: #> RSqBetaSandwich(object = std_mvn, alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Multiple correlation with MVN standard errors: #>        est     se      t df      p    2.5%  97.5% #> rsq 0.8045 4.1345 0.1946 42 0.8467 -7.5393 9.1483 #> adj 0.7906 4.4299 0.1785 42 0.8592 -8.1492 9.7304 summary(adf) #> Call: #> RSqBetaSandwich(object = std_adf, alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Multiple correlation with MVN standard errors: #>        est     se      t df      p    2.5%  97.5% #> rsq 0.8045 3.6172 0.2224 42 0.8251 -6.4953 8.1044 #> adj 0.7906 3.8756 0.2040 42 0.8394 -7.0307 8.6118 summary(hc3) #> Call: #> RSqBetaSandwich(object = std_hc3, alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Multiple correlation with HC3 standard errors: #>        est     se      t df      p    2.5%  97.5% #> rsq 0.8045 3.9483 0.2038 42 0.8395 -7.1635 8.7725 #> adj 0.7906 4.2303 0.1869 42 0.8527 -7.7466 9.3277

title: betaSandwich: Example Using the RSqBetaSandwich Function
text: Calculate R-squared adjusted R-squared.
code: coef(mvn) #>   rsq.rsq   adj.adj  #> 0.8045263 0.7905638 coef(adf) #>   rsq.rsq   adj.adj  #> 0.8045263 0.7905638 coef(hc3) #>   rsq.rsq   adj.adj  #> 0.8045263 0.7905638

what: Robust Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
title: Robust Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
text: Ivan Jacob Agaloos Pesigan 2023-07-01

title: Robust Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
text: Generates robust confidence intervals standardized regression coefficients using heteroskedasticity-consistent standard errors models fitted lm() described Dudgeon (2017: http://doi.org/10.1007/s11336-017-9563-z). description package code examples presented Pesigan, Sun, Cheung (2023: https://doi.org/10.1080/00273171.2023.2201277).

title: Robust Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
text: can install CRAN release betaSandwich : can install development version betaSandwich GitHub :
code: install.packages("betaSandwich") if (!require("remotes")) install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("jeksterslab/betaSandwich")

title: Robust Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
text: example, multiple regression model fitted using program quality ratings (QUALITY) regressand/outcome variable number published articles attributed program faculty members (NARTIC), percent faculty members holding research grants (PCTGRT), percentage program graduates received support (PCTSUPP) regressor/predictor variables using data set 1982 ratings 46 doctoral programs psychology USA (National Research Council, 1982). Robust confidence intervals standardized regression coefficients generated using BetaHC() function betaSandwich package following Dudgeon (2017).
code: library(betaSandwich) df <- betaSandwich::nas1982

what: Fit the regression model using the lm() function.
title: Robust Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
code: object <- lm(QUALITY ~ NARTIC + PCTGRT + PCTSUPP, data = df)

what: Estimate the standardized regression slopes and the corresponding robust sampling covariance matrix.
title: Robust Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
code: BetaHC(object, type = "hc3", alpha = 0.05) #> Call: #> BetaHC(object = object, type = "hc3", alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Standardized regression slopes with HC3 standard errors: #>            est     se      t df      p   2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC  0.4951 0.0786 6.3025 42 0.0000 0.3366 0.6537 #> PCTGRT  0.3915 0.0818 4.7831 42 0.0000 0.2263 0.5567 #> PCTSUPP 0.2632 0.0855 3.0786 42 0.0037 0.0907 0.4358

title: Robust Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
text: package can also used generate confidence intervals R-squared, adjusted R-squared, differences standardized regression coefficients.

title:
Estimate Differences of Standardized Slopes
and the Corresponding Sampling Covariance Matrix — DiffBetaSandwich
code: object <- lm(QUALITY ~ NARTIC + PCTGRT + PCTSUPP, data = nas1982) std <- BetaHC(object) diff <- DiffBetaSandwich(std) # Methods ------------------------------------------------------- print(diff) #> Call: #> DiffBetaSandwich(object = std) #>  #> Difference between standardized regression coefficients with HC3 standard errors: #>                   est     se      z      p   0.05%    0.5%    2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.1037 0.1417 0.7316 0.4644 -0.3626 -0.2613 -0.1741 0.3814 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.2319 0.1318 1.7595 0.0785 -0.2018 -0.1076 -0.0264 0.4902 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.1282 0.1375 0.9329 0.3509 -0.3241 -0.2259 -0.1412 0.3977 #>                 99.5% 99.95% #> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.4686 0.5699 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.5714 0.6656 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.4823 0.5806 summary(diff) #> Call: #> DiffBetaSandwich(object = std) #>  #> Difference between standardized regression coefficients with HC3 standard errors: #>                   est     se      z      p   0.05%    0.5%    2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.1037 0.1417 0.7316 0.4644 -0.3626 -0.2613 -0.1741 0.3814 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.2319 0.1318 1.7595 0.0785 -0.2018 -0.1076 -0.0264 0.4902 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.1282 0.1375 0.9329 0.3509 -0.3241 -0.2259 -0.1412 0.3977 #>                 99.5% 99.95% #> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.4686 0.5699 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.5714 0.6656 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.4823 0.5806 coef(diff) #>  NARTIC-PCTGRT NARTIC-PCTSUPP PCTGRT-PCTSUPP  #>      0.1036564      0.2318974      0.1282410  vcov(diff) #>                NARTIC-PCTGRT NARTIC-PCTSUPP PCTGRT-PCTSUPP #> NARTIC-PCTGRT    0.020076382    0.009274583   -0.010801799 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP   0.009274583    0.017370731    0.008096148 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP  -0.010801799    0.008096148    0.018897947 confint(diff, level = 0.95) #>                      2.5 %    97.5 % #> NARTIC-PCTGRT  -0.17405314 0.3813660 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP -0.02642203 0.4902169 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP -0.14119483 0.3976769

title: Print Method for an Object of Class betasandwich — print.betasandwich
code: object <- lm(QUALITY ~ NARTIC + PCTGRT + PCTSUPP, data = nas1982) std <- BetaHC(object) print(std) #> Call: #> BetaHC(object = object) #>  #> Standardized regression slopes with HC3 standard errors: #>            est     se      t df      p   0.05%   0.5%   2.5%  97.5%  99.5% #> NARTIC  0.4951 0.0786 6.3025 42 0.0000  0.2172 0.2832 0.3366 0.6537 0.7071 #> PCTGRT  0.3915 0.0818 4.7831 42 0.0000  0.1019 0.1707 0.2263 0.5567 0.6123 #> PCTSUPP 0.2632 0.0855 3.0786 42 0.0037 -0.0393 0.0325 0.0907 0.4358 0.4940 #>         99.95% #> NARTIC  0.7731 #> PCTGRT  0.6810 #> PCTSUPP 0.5658

title: Print Method for an Object of Class diffbetasandwich — print.diffbetasandwich
code: object <- lm(QUALITY ~ NARTIC + PCTGRT + PCTSUPP, data = nas1982) std <- BetaHC(object) diff <- DiffBetaSandwich(std) print(diff) #> Call: #> DiffBetaSandwich(object = std) #>  #> Difference between standardized regression coefficients with HC3 standard errors: #>                   est     se      z      p   0.05%    0.5%    2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.1037 0.1417 0.7316 0.4644 -0.3626 -0.2613 -0.1741 0.3814 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.2319 0.1318 1.7595 0.0785 -0.2018 -0.1076 -0.0264 0.4902 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.1282 0.1375 0.9329 0.3509 -0.3241 -0.2259 -0.1412 0.3977 #>                 99.5% 99.95% #> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.4686 0.5699 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.5714 0.6656 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.4823 0.5806

title: Print Method for an Object of Class rsqbetasandwich — print.rsqbetasandwich
code: object <- lm(QUALITY ~ NARTIC + PCTGRT + PCTSUPP, data = nas1982) std <- BetaHC(object) rsq <- RSqBetaSandwich(std) print(rsq) #> Call: #> RSqBetaSandwich(object = std) #>  #> Multiple correlation with HC3 standard errors: #>        est     se      t df      p    0.05%     0.5%    2.5%  97.5%   99.5% #> rsq 0.8045 3.9483 0.2038 42 0.8395 -13.1636  -9.8483 -7.1635 8.7725 11.4573 #> adj 0.7906 4.2303 0.1869 42 0.8527 -14.1753 -10.6231 -7.7466 9.3277 12.2043 #>      99.95% #> rsq 14.7726 #> adj 15.7564
